definition: surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)

sentences.english: How prophet Elisa face the army of Syria by trusting God?
sentences.chinese: 神人以利沙如何靠著神面对亚兰大军？

sentences.english: The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
sentences.chinese: 底珊的儿子是乌斯和亚兰。

sentences.english: These were the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Paddan Aram.
sentences.chinese: 这是雅各在巴旦亚兰所生的儿子。

sentences.english: Hazael king of Aram oppressed Israel throughout the reign of Jehoahaz.
sentences.chinese: 约哈斯年间，亚兰王哈薛屡次欺压以色列人。

sentences.english: The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.
sentences.chinese: 底珊的儿子是乌斯，亚兰。

sentences.english: So Hazael king of Syria died; and Benhadad his son reigned in his stead.
sentences.chinese: 亚兰王哈薛死了，他儿子便哈达接续他作王。

sentences.english: Jacob had only eleven sons born to him before he left Laban in Paddan Aram eg Northern Euphrates .
sentences.chinese: 雅各在巴旦亚兰离开拉班前共生了十一个儿子。

sentences.english: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.
sentences.chinese: 雅各从巴旦亚兰回来，神又向他显现，赐福与他。

definition: Asa (?-870 BC), third king of Judah and fifth king of the House of David (Judaism)
phonetic fei or fi/elegant/phi (Greek letter Φ, φ)
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
(phonetic na)/used esp. in female names such as Anna 安娜[An1 na4] or Diana 黛安娜[Dai4 an1 na4]
a noble steed (literary)/(of a horse) untamed/(fig.) (of a person) headstrong/Taiwan pr. [ao2]
see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]
